ratings.comment: Professor Moua is truly such a great professor. She cares a lot about what she is teaching and about her students. As long as you are willing to read a lot and be an active participant in the class, this course will be pretty easy and fun! She's super supportive and makes a point to get to know all of her students, which is great.

Great professor! She is very caring and understanding. Tries her best to get the class to participate in discussions. Students get to facilitate one discussion during the semesters which was easier than I thought. Her assignments are worth a lot of points however, it is really easy to get them done. Easy A for an ethnic credit requirement.

Chong Moua is by far one of the best professors I have ever had. She is very carking, kind and respects everyone by wanting to learn who you are individually. However class can be very awkward and challenging to participate in because she doesn't entice discussions very well in class. Otherwise she is amazing.

Prof. Moua's class was fun and informative. Assignments were a cakewalk if you do most of the readings. Both the Prof. and TA want you to succeed and are incredibly understanding and thoughtful! This class is perfect if you want to learn more about the Hmong people without backbreaking coursework.

I usually never give ratings but Professor Moua was sooo amazing! This is one of my favorite classes I have taken at UW-Madison. She is so understanding if you just communicate with her. She understands that people have lives outside of school along with other hard classes. She truly cares about her students & wants them to succeed!
A really nice professor. The first thing she pays attention to is always our health, then is our work. She engaged in students' discussion and the atmosphere of the class is really comfortable!

I really like Professor Moua! The class itself is pretty easy for being intermediate (so I definitely recommend taking it for an ethnic studies requirement). The lectures are kind of dry, but still really interesting. I never needed to go in for office hours, but I got the vibe that she was really there for people who needed help.

2 papers, one of them being our final, and 1 midterm. She gave us a review sheet for the midterm, and the papers had very clear rubrics. Tons of extra credit. Lots of reading, but as someone with a tough course load, didn't regret taking this class at all. She wants students to do well! Make sure to participate and you will be fine.

4 extra credit quizzes, one midterm and she tells you literally everything you need to know and tells us the answers in the review session, clear on what to do for papers, and the nicest human ever. Take this class. Yes, you have to read a reasonable amount but it's worth it. Put in a real and honest effort and you'll get an A. I finished with a 97

The class consists of 3 papers and 1 midterm. No final. Professor Moua is great and clearly cares about her students. She made it very clear to her students what is expected of them. Great class and a great professor. Highly recommend

Information in this class is very clear. Chong was very straight forward and understood that some of us were only there for an ethnic studies requirement. Would highly reccomend taking a class with her!

Chong is an amazing lecturer. I also took her AAS540 and she does a fantastic job of fostering a classroom environment that allows meaningful discussion from students of all backgrounds. She is caring and understands that class participation may come in different forms. Side note: she can sometimes go through her PowerPoint slides quickly

Chong is very caring and kind! She wants her students to learn a lot about Hmong Refugee History and the origins of the Hmong people. She has a lot of extra credit opportunities that are super easy to do. She's generally an easy grader and her essay's are clear and straight forward. We also made spring rolls on the last day of class.
